channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: DepEd urged to postpone reopening of classes, consider regional resumptions
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: "Forcing schools to open this August will only defeat the purpose of education. Let us accept the fact that we are not fully ready, and it will not be wise, to simultaneously open School Year 2020-2021," Tolentino said during a Senate hearing.

item.title: Duterte won't hesitate to fire 'soldier of principles' Morales if found corrupt — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte views Philippine Health Insurance Corp. chief Ricardo Morales as a "soldier of courage and principles" but he won't hesitate to fire him if there is proof that he is into anomalies, Malacañang said Wednesday.

item.title: COVID-19 infections in Philippines now over 143,000 with 4,444 new cases
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Updated 4:21 p.m.) The coronavirus pandemic has killed more than 741,000 people worldwide with 20.29 million infected.

item.title: Citing past probes, Karapatan doubts task force investigation into Echanis killing
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Guevarra, reacting to Karapatan’s statement, said that the department would just proceed with its work.

item.title: Police have no authority to hold Echanis' body, demand DNA test — lawyer
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "We told you so. Withholding Echanis’ remains was plain harassment and delaying tactics for whatever your sinister agenda is on his cadaver. Ka Randy was due for autopsy when the PNP forcibly took his body from the family. The police are clearly trying to prevent us from knowing the cause of death."

item.title: Public assured: FDA to evaluate Russian vaccine first
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Russia claimed the vaccine developed by Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology works even though it has not undergone Phase 3 clinical trials

item.title: Morales to go on medical leave amid probes into alleged corruption at PhilHealth
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: The PhilHealth chief's condition was publicized after he sent a medical certificate, dated August 7, to the Senate Committee of the Whole which stated that he was undergoing treatment for lymphoma and that he had been advised by his doctors to take a leave of absence.

item.title: US trials watchdog to Philippines: Be ‘cautious’ in trying out ‘Sputnik V’ vaccine
item.author: Jeremiah Opiniano
item.description: A non-profit group monitoring worldwide vaccine clinical trials wished the Philippines caution in trying out the “first registered” COVID-19 vaccine that Russian scientists developed, and whose “advanced trials” start today.

item.title: DOH: LGUs are 'main implementers' of contact tracing efforts
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said it is the department’s duty to provide guidelines and standards for contact tracing efforts.

item.title: Rights lawyers assert: Police no authority to hold Echanis body
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Groups of rights lawyers are backing their colleagues facing criminal raps while performing their duty in the wake of the murder of peasant leader Randall Echanis.
